posts.cooked:
Chats have no interactivity when pressing the right mouse button onto them.

It would be better to have context menus, so we could:

  • Pin chat to top
  • View contact / profile
  • Disable notifications
  • Mark as unread
  • Delete chat
  • Clear history

Currenty, some of these are accessible directly in the chat, but not as the ‚Äúright click‚Äù context menu.

link_counts.title: Add right-click context menu for conversations in Signal Desktop
Archive a chat without opening it

posts.name: Marty
posts.cooked:
I can attest that this feature is strongly needed.

I have been using Signal for months and ‚ÄúMark as Unread‚Äù is a very important feature for me in messengers. On the Signal Desktop App however I thought for the longest time it wasn‚Äôt possible. After making an Issue on Github I was told the option exists, but it‚Äôs under the global context menu in the top right‚Ä¶ makes no sense to put chat-specific menu options there imo.

I second a context menu by right click, as it‚Äôs more intuitive and would actually de-clutter the global menu in the top-right.

posts.name: Mueller Ma
posts.cooked:
It could be done like Firefox‚Äô context menu on webpages:

A few common items can be represented as icons, e.g. video call, phone call and search. Other items can be text below these icons, e.g. all/most items from the current menu in the chat view:

posts.name: link ‚ú¶
posts.cooked: @Leptopoda Right-clicking on a chat in the sidebar doesn‚Äôt present any context menu (at least on macOS as of 5.23.0-beta.1), so I don‚Äôt think this feature request is implemented yet.
I misread the FR thanks for correcting me.

posts.name: Samuel Plumppu
posts.cooked:
The Signal mobile apps just got a new context menu with icons when you long press chats. Something similar could be implemented for the desktop app too!

Implementing this feature would likely not require more than adding an onContextMenu event handler just like the one for onClick is added here: Signal-Desktop/ConversationList.tsx at main ¬∑ signalapp/Signal-Desktop ¬∑ GitHub

The tricky part is accessibility, adding tests, using the right icons to match the mobile apps, and probably updating the top right context menu to effectively move those options to the conversation itself instead.

There‚Äôs also a potential issue with touch-enabled laptops where it would make sense to also enable long press events to open the context menu for conversations.

But still, implementing this would make the desktop UX much better without requiring too much dev + design time.

Yes please! I desperately need this feature on desktop!

On desktop (Windows) I would expect that right-clicking on the conversation list would do something. Right now it does nothing which is unexpected.

Let me illustrate by example. I believe right clicking should do the same thing that this ‚Ä¶ thing does at the upper right, but only once you enter the chat:

Clicking the ‚Ä¶ shows a pop up menu, which is great!

image358√ó569 6.92 KB

Unfortunately, right clicking on a user/convo doesn‚Äôt do anything at all, which is inefficient and inconsistent. You shouldn‚Äôt have to enter the conversation to archive it or have access to these menu options. Thus, I suggest right clicking any conversation should invoke the same menu , like so:

image489√ó522 23.2 KB

Thank you!

I am also willing to sponsor this change with a large donation, if that helps, on the order of $5,000 USD.

Hi codinghorror! Welcome and great 1st post!

Signal should seriously consider this suggestion and immense offer!!!

Just to add value to this discussion, as stated, the mock-up would also work very well with the chat list collapsed, which is how I use it.

Some additional info

This particular forum isn‚Äôt configured to ever delete your IP address. Even after account anonymization. So suggest a VPN as the Moderators aren‚Äôt all staff.

link_counts.title: What information is removed when a forum user is anonymized?

posts.name: Paul Van Cotthem
posts.cooked:
Summary:
Please add support for right-clicking on a conversation in the conversation list in Signal Desktop to open a context menu with the following actions:

  • Archive conversation
  • Mark as unread
  • Delete conversation

Why it matters:
Currently, users have to rely on a ‚Äú‚Ä¶ menu‚Äù option for actions on conversations, which slows down workflow and makes the interface feel less intuitive ‚Äî especially for power users or those used to other messaging platforms (e.g. WhatsApp, Telegram, or email clients like Outlook and Gmail) where right-click on conversations are standard UX.

Benefits:

  • Improves usability and discoverability of key actions
  • Speeds up task execution (e.g. quickly archiving a chat)
  • Aligns with user expectations for desktop app behavior

Suggested behavior:
On right-clicking a conversation thread (in the left-side conversation list), a small pop-up menu should appear with:

  1. Archive
  2. Mark as unread
  3. Delete
  4. ‚Ä¶

Each option should perform the same action as currently available via icons or menus, just with quicker access.
